data.title: Not what we hoped for.
data.text: Server at the take out counter was very nice. The baby back ribs were mostly fat. Had to fight the bones out.  Pulled pork was quite dry and lacked smokey flavor. Potato salad was the only real pleasure. Pricing was comparable to others. Would not go back.

data.title: Loud, Irritating, Crackling Speaker Music, Mixed Food Satisfaction
data.text: Four of us had dinner around 7:00 pm on a Saturday evening. The restaurant was less than half full but this location is rarely packed. We were seated in a booth in the corner under a crackling speaker that was very loud and blaring harsh, inappropriate music. We asked to have the speaker turned lower and were told we were the second person to request it but they aren't allowed to do so. They moved us to another booth and a very nice asst. manager visited our table. He explained that the owner wants the lights low and the music loud and they weren't allowed to touch it. This is a family restaurant in a family neighborhood, not a nightclub. If the speakers were good quality and the music appropriate, it would not have been so irritating. One diner had the Zack n Cheese pulled pork sandwich with fries that they said was very good. A second diner ordered the fried catfish dinner which arrived in a pool of grease and was very dark. It was served with a slice of garlic toast. The sides were the diner's choices of fries and collard greens. After using 5 napkins to soak the grease up off the plate and off of only one of the 3 pieces of fish, the diner cut into the fish and it was mushy. It was very overcooked and tasted like burned oil. The dinner was removed from the check and the Adam & Eve sandwich with boneless pork rib was substituted. The diner enjoyed that sandwich. A third diner ordered the BBQ Turkey sandwich which instead of the expected pulled fresh roasted turkey had a few slabs of what seemed like a pressed turkey product like spam. It was not good, but he ate it anyway. His side was fries. As a vegetarian in a BBQ restaurant, I ordered the baby greens and gorgonzola salad. The toppings included dried cranberries, slivers of carrot and roasted, salted peanuts. It is served with packets of Ken's steakhouse raspberry vinaigrette and a slice of garlic toast. The combination of toppings with the vinaigrette was pleasing and the greens were fresh. The disappointment is in the greens possibly not being rinsed to get the well water preservative taste off of them. I also ordered a side of mac and cheese which was hot and tasty. Our server was very efficient, cheerful and accommodating. The assistant manager was very nice. They were accommodating in everything that they had authority to do and were eager to please the customer. We got 2 checks for the table which were around $ 26 and $ 30 each including tip. If you go to this restaurant, order any pork BBQ menu selection. This seems to be the common denominator in the only meals that were enjoyed.

data.title: Always Good Food !
data.text: Great Wings and close ! They also have good Pulled pork ! PA has a few locations around Palm Beach !

data.title: Some lessons are hard learned
data.text: When you go to a BBQ restaurant, order BBQ.  We didn't, and we had to throw away the sandwiches (Zac & Mac) because they were just awful.  We were in between lacross games and needed something quick to eat.  We ended up here.  Our waitress was very sweet, but the service was so slow, we practically had to get up out of the table before we could get them "in gear."  Ended up having to take the food to go, which is the reason we ended up throwing it away, instead of sending it back to the kitchen.  On the other hand, the restaurant had several people who appeared satisfied with their meals.  Of course, it looked like they were all eating BBQ!  The food was expensive, which made it even more painful.  The only thing we can say is, if you go, order the BBQ.

data.title: Great place for the weekend with the family
data.text: My family likes to come to PA BBQ from time to time. When everybody craves for good ribs and wings, this is the place. I almost didn't have time to take the picture of our food, as it disappeared so fast... The place is cozy, owner is nice and food is great. The only thing I would recommend for the restaurant is for the servers to take a look from time to time if we need something.

data.title: Decent quick BBQ
data.text: Food is decent, pulled pork is really good and the hot pickles and sweet tea are awesome..good spot!

data.title: Best BBQ anywhere...
data.text: I'm not really a BBQ fan, but this place has the best BBQ around (specifically the baby back ribs). I was told that this is because they have a patent on a special kind of smoker! The service is usually either hit or miss, but on this trip it was great.

data.title: Average BBQ ribs
data.text: I have been to this restaurant many times over the years and this is the first time I was disappointed. The baby back ribs seemed to have been a leftover from a prior day. Overlooked and dry. I did not complain as I did not want to upset my elderly family member I. Was having dinner with. Last year was not as good as the year before. I hope this is not a trend downward as I have enjoyed coming here in the past. However, now I cannot give this a good recommendation.

data.title: food
data.text: lots of good items of food to eat, the waitresses were out standing and made sure that your filled up in order to leave.. they are hot too

data.title: Friendly Staff, Poor Taste
data.text: Park Avenue used to be a favorite of mine, but every one I go to now gets less desirable than the last. The staff is friendly enough, but that just doesn't make up for the poor tasting BBQ. Everything is bland and tastes frozen. The only place for me now is Smoke BBQ in Delray Beach.

data.title: Carry out window! Must ring bell for service?!
data.text: My family and I absolutely love park avenue BBQ! We've been frequenting all locations for years. Today we ordered carry out for lunch and I was ignored by the waitress working the window for over 10 minutes! She clearly saw me standing at the window waiting for my order which was sitting right on the counter in front of her and she just continued to go about her business like I wasn't even there. To top it off there wasn't another soul in the restaurant! The manager of this location should really train his carry out waitress how to treat customers! When she finally did come to the window to hand over my luke warm lunch she pointed to the bell on the wall and told me to ring it for service! Unbelievable!

data.title: Good reliable southern BBQ
data.text: Reliable family style food, southern soul food of a sort.  I love the collard greens here.  The BBQ is always reliably good, and we enjoyt he ribs.  My friend loves the catfish here (I have never tried).  Always helpful staff, manager is very involved

data.title: Mediocre BBQ at best
data.text: Certainly not my style of BBQ, ribs were mushy and soggy like they'd been boiled to death then slathered in sauce. My wife's had the brisket, and it was very dry and had very little flavor. Personally I think BBQ'd meat needs to stand on it's on with flavor, and just get a little bonus boost from the sauce, not need the sauce to be edible, which is where Park Aves meats are.

data.title: pulled pork tough ;all else very good
data.text: we have been many times and always were pleased. This time we found the very generous portions of pulled pork in the oversized sandwhiches unusually tough. The sides of potaato salad , cole slaw ,fries and especially collard greens were prepared southern style and tasty.Beers are inexpensive with a large  variety of domestic and intl brands available. Our waitress was especially friendly.

data.title: Great Barbeque and the price is always down to earth.
data.text: This is a place you can not miss, if you like rea; Barbeque food. The service is always great and the servers are always friendly. When you place your order, it seems that in just a very short while, there is your food hot and plenty of it. My family always enjoys the Chicken and ribs, along with the great side. The bar is well equipted and the br people know how to mix a drink, without a ton of ice. The price is right and you will never be disappointed.

data.title: Very good BBQ Ribs and Chicken
data.text: Good family restaurant if you like BBQ. Good and friendly service. I have eaten here many time over many year when I visit Florida. It has been consistent in quality and value. Casual dining.

data.title: Very good wings.
data.text:
Their wings are nice sized and meaty. They don't drown them in sauce.

This location has a "call-ahead" pickup window. Very easy to order over the phone. They even supply paper plates & eating utensils.

data.title: Great Wellington-not N. Palm Beach
data.text: Wellington location has consistently good food and service. North Palm beach has consistently lukewarm food, poor or no service -and manager that are busy chatting with employees and do not acknowledge much. Surprisingly it is busy. Maybe because the customers are waiting so long that they are at the table way to long.

data.title: Very good ... just one improvement
data.text: This place could make a killing, but one big thing is holding it back. First, the good. Lots of reasonably priced items, and the variety of side dishes are above average. The portions are massive. The BBQ sauce is sublime (and probably the reason everyone comes back). Service is also fantastic and the wait staff is super friendly. But there's one thing I'd improve tomorrow if I owned this joint. I'd give it a big makeover. The 90s theme clearly drives customers away, especially with all the food choices in the area, and a local crowd that demands a hip atmosphere. Lindbergers and Tijuana Flats are much more palatable. Shane's food is not nearly as good, but yes, the atmosphere is even better there ... and that's not saying much. It would be money well invested and probably not cost much to give Park Avenue a new look. I'd go a lot more often if it looked better because the food is pretty darned good.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: My wife and I had the baby back ribs.  They were under cooked and very tuff.  The baked beans seemed like they had just come from a can.  They were bland and luke warm.  We have not been back to this restaurant for over a year for these reasons.  We took advantage of the Amex offer and thought that we would give it another try.  Never Again.
